definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Chueh-hui could feel the cold seeping into his bones.
sentences.chinese: 覺慧開始覺得寒氣透過衣服浸到身上來了。

sentences.english: The old man shivered in the cold that came after the sunset.
sentences.chinese: 日落之後，寒氣襲人，老人凍得發抖。

sentences.english: It was five and a half o'clock now, and a raw, blustering morning.
sentences.chinese: 這時才五點半，正是寒氣逼人，狂風咆哮的早晨。

sentences.english: The many-faceted jewel that feels somewhat cold to the touch.
sentences.chinese: 微微泛着寒氣的多面珠寶。

sentences.english: South-east Europe, in particular, continued to feel the chill.
sentences.chinese: 尤其受到事件影響的歐洲東南部目前依然寒氣逼人。

sentences.english: I felt a child go down my spine.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得有一股寒氣順着我的脊樑骨往下竄。

sentences.english: The poor worker's thin jacket couldn't keep out the cold.
sentences.chinese: 那個窮工人的薄褂子擋不住寒氣。

sentences.english: Late on the afternoon of a chilly day in February, two gentlemen were sitting alone over their wine.
sentences.chinese: 二月裏某日黃昏，寒氣襲人，有兩個紳士對坐小酌。

sentences.english: The rain has chilled me to the bone.
sentences.chinese: 這場雨使我感到寒氣刺骨。

sentences.english: Have a drop. It'll ward off the cold of the night.
sentences.chinese: 喝一口擋擋夜裏的寒氣。

sentences.english: The first time, the chill crescent moon was really chill.
sentences.chinese: 那第一次，帶着寒氣的月牙兒確是帶着寒氣。

sentences.english: The first time, the chill crescent moon was really chill.
sentences.chinese: 那第一次，帶着寒氣的月牙兒確是帶着寒氣。

sentences.english: After a few seconds I turned on the light and felt the piercing chill to heart.
sentences.chinese: 幾秒鐘之後我把燈打開，感到寒氣透心。

sentences.english: There is a cold nip in the air.
sentences.chinese: 一股寒氣透過他的皮肉直刺骨髓。

sentences.english: Without chilly aurora, how could smoke turn itself into pleasant colored clouds?
sentences.chinese: 沒有寒氣襲人的晨曦，煙霧何以變成溫馨可人的彩霞？

sentences.english: There was a chill in the air this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上有點寒氣襲人。

definition: evil influence/unhealthy trend/(a person's) evil air/aura of wickedness/(TCM) pathogenic energy (opposite: 正氣|正气[zheng4 qi4], vital energy)
to suffer from pent-up frustrations/mental knot/emotional issue
to stagnate/to congeal/(fig.) to stop still/to freeze
(of a vapor etc) to rise/to hang in the air
